website_summaries.verdict: Affordable, high quality option that tracks heart rate without all the bells and whistles.
pros: Transmits heart rate data directly to Forerunner 50
Should be paired with The Edge 305Hr or the Edgecard
Soft fabric materiel that can adjust to your size
Strap can be removed from monitor and hand washed
cons: Some customers commented that the readers were inconsistent

customer_reviews.title: I actually like this heart rate monitor better than Garmin's "Premium" soft ...
customer_reviews.text: I actually like this heart rate monitor better than Garmin's "Premium" soft strap model for several reasons: 1. It costs $18 less. 2. The battery is much easier to change. 3. The "soft" straps on the more expensive "Premium" model don't stay flat, and easily twist.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff B.

customer_reviews.title: Better than the premium soft strap HRM !!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for a while and bought a premium (soft strap) one when that was in sale. I’m surprise to find out that this HRM is way better than the newer and more expensive model in both ease of wearing / I wearing and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Angus Chen

customer_reviews.title: Junk, absolutely worthless. Do not buy this.
customer_reviews.text: I did everything to facilitate getting an accurate and consistent reading. - Body hair is trimmed - Used electrode gel - inserted a new battery - Tried it with different amounts of tightness and kept readjusting trying to find a workable position. In the end, I have junk that will only connect on and off on roughly 10 second intervals, and the reading it gives is completely inaccurate. Do not buy this. I previously owned the softstrap that worked well, but gave up after 3 years. Consider getting one of those or something from another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Ruger

customer_reviews.title: Works well, comfortable enough for me, great price. ANT+ only
customer_reviews.text: Low cost, works well with my Garmin cycling computer, and comfortable enough. ANT+ only support, no bluetooth, so make sure you have a device it will work with. I got it for under $25, so it was a great deal on a good monitor. I have read other reviews claiming it is un-comfortable, this has not been my experience, perhaps they have adjusted the strap too tight. I ride 6-10 hours a week with it on and I just forget it's there, until I look at my cycling computer to get a look at my heart rate.
customer_reviews.author: CLAY M GLAD

customer_reviews.title: Only works with Garmin devices or ANT+, no Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: Instructions were mostly worthless on connecting device. Link to Garmin website that provided connecting information was a broken link. Could not find anything on Garmin site. Finally found information that the ANT+ devices will not connect to any iOS device without a dongle or not at all. Nothing in the listing that describes where the device will connect. Ordered a bluetooth device to connect to Peloton running on my iPad.
customer_reviews.author: J. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, connects easily with Garmin GPSMAP 64st
customer_reviews.text: Connected without problems to my GPSMAP 64st (which I use for cycling, among other things). After short while, you forget you are wearing it. Only slight complaint: The battery was already installed when received. So I have no idea how long it has been running (no on/off switch),or how much battery life remaining. Others have commented that this is better than another model that has fabric straps?? This unit has a fabric elastic strap. The center piece where the electronics/battery/sensors are (about 1 foot long) is rubber. The remainder of the strap is fabric/elastic.
customer_reviews.author: GScott

customer_reviews.title: NOT BLUETOOTH
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this HR chest monitor to work with my Endomondo app on my Samsung Galaxy S7. Endomondo had allowed the pairing of this monitor by giving the option to pair with devices using Ant+ sensors(this monitor is not bluetooth but uses the ant+ sensor). I was able to pair w/o an issue. Now Endomondo will only allow Bluetooth devices to pair w its fitness app,, eliminating the ant+ sensor option. Therefore this monitor can't be used on the Endomondo app any longer. Should've paid more and purchased a bluetooth strap.
customer_reviews.author: Dano

customer_reviews.title: Just works
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to pair with my Wahoo Elemnt Bolt. Once paired, that's it. No need to turn it on, off, or even think about it. Initially I wondered if it would be comfortable. But after a few minutes riding I don't think about it. It doesn't move around, slip down, anything. I don't know how long the battery will last, but it's lasted 5 months so far. Paired with my Elemnt Bolt, I get continuous heart rate during my rides. After my ride, I do rinse the sweat off with hot water. That seems to have been enough because it's not collected salt or sweat in the band.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Don’t spend any more.  This works great.
customer_reviews.text: Just put it on, started pedaling on Peloton bike and it immediately started reading. Rubber strap is the best! Doesn’t slide and easy to clean. So much better than “soft straps”.
customer_reviews.author: AEM

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: I previously had the soft version, so was a little leery of this harder strap. But the price and reviews convinced me to try it. I'm glad I did. Just used it for 5 rides so far, but I have been surprised by the comfort, and it's performance so far has been better than the soft strap, which would occasionally not read or transmit well. Can't really speak to battery life, but it does seem to be pretty well made, so don't foresee durability issues.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: This works with the VivoActive HR, and is super comfortable!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can connect this to my Vivo Active HR watch during workouts as it’s far more accurate than the wrist measurements. When you attach it to your watch and you use it for workouts make sure to wet it before you put it on, especially if you’re not a sweater. Honestly I didn’t even notice I had it on. It felt like a comfortable sports bra strap. Also it will be the primary HR measurement when connected to your VivoActive HR.. you don’t even have to change the settings once you connect it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is working great with my Samsung S5 and the SHealth app
customer_reviews.text: This is working great with my Samsung S5 and the SHealth app. I don't know if this is necessary but to get it working I had to turn on bluetooth. I got in to the Samsung app and start a circuit workout, click at the top right, and chick accessories, then click scan. I have to be wearing it before it will register anything in the app. I have tried all of the watches and none of them are accurate. This is the only accurate HRM I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Donisthorpe

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT purchase this heart monitor. Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these, one arrived DOA, and the other quit working within days. I assumed that it was just a battery, so I replaced both batteries to no avail. I decided to return one of the two for an exchange and had to pay an additional $6 for shipping to replace the failed device. When the replacement heart monitor arrived, yes you guessed it, DOA. Again, the battery replacement failed to remedy. Save yourself the hassle, and spend a little more for a higher quality product. I am incredibly disappointed as I thought that "Garmen" was a high quality product. I will think twice about purchasing any future Garmen fitness equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Walczak

customer_reviews.title: Completely Inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for about 25 workouts over the last two months and have found to it to provide unreliable readings. I make sure the sensor is wet prior to/throughout the workout and have positioned it in numerous places to see what works best but it almost always reads my heart rate far below reality. When it does give me an accurate reading, it only lasts about 5-10 minutes before becoming inaccurate again. I have used it for sprints, long distance runs, and weightlifting with similar results. Paired with a Garmin Tactix Charlie. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Tyeler

customer_reviews.title: A good low profile solution
customer_reviews.text: Probably the cheapest possible offering of the units I was looking at, but functions all the same. Only real issue is that it has to be reset every so often by completely removing the battery and re-pairing with my phone. It doesn't seem to like being bent beyond a certain point either, like the connections aren't functional until I straighten out the whole thing and test bluetooth pairing again. Still, exceedingly inexpensive, and does what it needs to do without sticking out of my chest under my compression shirt.
customer_reviews.author: A. Earle

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Peloton
customer_reviews.text: I bought this HRM because my Garmin watch would cadence lock while riding my peloton. It was frustrating and distracting to see my heart rate bounce around so much. For $20, you can't beat this. My heart rate is recorded as a very smooth increases and decreases. Not so much a negative, but it can take some time for your heart rate to be "locked on" before your workout. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Tiny, hard to pair and hard to use
customer_reviews.text: I am 190lbs and 6 feet tall, and this barely fits around my chest on the largest adjustment. If you look like you might have any chance of making a high school football team, it won't fit you. It took me a long time to pair with my Garmin 645, and nothing in either manual was particularly helpful. While troubleshooting it, I opened the battery compartment, which was also a bit of a pain. It is too narrow for a finger, but too big to use a screw driver or knife without scratching the plastic - I used a quarter, but a half dollar would be better. Does not seem like a product anyone put much thought into.
customer_reviews.author: Brad V.

customer_reviews.title: Great value and works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Received this strap yesterday and used ot for a 2 hour bike ride on the trainer. It synced immediately with my Trainer Road app and I forgot I had it on after about 2 minutes of wearing it. It worked perfectly for the entire ride.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: This things is awesome for price
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome... Have it paired to vivoactive 3 and also tried it with galaxy s8. You get the occasional drop but nothing crazy... Way better than optical heart rate on vívoactive 3 or any smart watch out there for interval training.... Ant+ only (no bluetooth) but u probably already know that
customer_reviews.author: HelloWorld

customer_reviews.title: More accurate while exercising than the VivoActive built-in HR monitor
customer_reviews.text: I had issues with the first one that was easily exchanged for another. After experiencing the same issue with the second monitor, I searched the web and found an app that could be downloaded on my Garmin VivoActive HR that solved the issue. Now it works as expected. It is more accurate while exercising than the VivoActive built-in HR monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Big D

customer_reviews.title: Works fine.
customer_reviews.text: This HRM connects pronto with my Garmin Edge 25. There is no need to purchase the higher priced HRM as this one works just fine. That being said, I haven't used it on any outdoor rides so I can't say how it might feel on really hot days. So far though, I'm a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Trainor

customer_reviews.title: Reliability
customer_reviews.text: This is the one to get. A previous reviewer spoke about the tiny screws on the soft strap. He/she was 100% correct. Those tiny screws strip and corrode. The soft strap is in the garbage now. This strap is slightly lower tech, but is hugely more reliable. I had one previously, and had similar ones from other manufacturers. Forget about the soft strap. Get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Muttdog

customer_reviews.title: Would not pair or recognize any exercise equipment at 3 gyms
customer_reviews.text: Tried this on Precor machines, Life Fitness and Hammer equipment. It was frustrating to say the least. Would also only pair to the garmin watch activity counter. Blah. Spend the extra $40 and get the next one up.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Once you have it paired works with zero struggle. One thing that wasn't obvious is that this only works with my Garmin Instinct while in a workout mode. Couldn't get it to work for the longest time until I was told this. No big deal since this is the only way I use it, but couldn't figure out how to pair it until tech support told me this.
customer_reviews.author: OMAR GARCIA

customer_reviews.title: For me, better than the soft strapped version
customer_reviews.text: The gold standard in heart rate monitor straps. This one might not be as comfortable as the soft strap version, but it will last infinitely longer. My first one of these lasted 8 years, with multiple battery changes (from the original Garmin Edge 305). Battery changes are easy with just a coin, and if put back together correctly, it is water proof over and over. Compared to the soft strapped version with the tiny screws (which I use for running), this one is a breeze to change batteries on.
customer_reviews.author: fuel98rider

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this product. I was so excited to receive my heart rate monitor. Unfortunately, it doesn't fit at all. It is huge on me. I am average size 5'4" and 135lbs but my rib cage right where the monitor needs to sit is about 26" around. I haven't tried running with the heart rate monitor yet, but I doubt it will be able to stay in place. I'm currently about 10lbs over my normal weight so there is no way this band will continue to fit once I lose weight.
customer_reviews.author: Odette

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent readings after 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 3-18-2018. During a particularly hard bike ride my heart rate jumped 25%. Inconsistent with my second monitor. Next day it went back to normal. At least for 1/2 of the ride, then went high again. Change of batteries and a reset made no difference. Ordered a replacement today 7-19-2018. Only lasted 4 months. Hope the new one works longer.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Jongeward

customer_reviews.title: I gave this 5 stars bc they don't allow 10 stars.  Great for the Peloton
customer_reviews.text: WOW this is great! I bought it for use on the Peloton, as recommended by a friend. I wasn't sure how good it would be bc of the price, but it is GREAT! It synced (if that's the word) right up to the bike, and have no issues! cleaning is easy, just rinse/wipe it off and you're good to go. I would most certainly buy this one and recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Dan R

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to the Garmin Premium HR strap
customer_reviews.text: The premium hr unit I had lasted 5 years but started acting up. I thought it was the strap but after replacing that I realized it was the head unit itself. A complete replacement costs over $50. This unit costs me less than $25. It easily paired with my Garmin Edge 130. I would highly recommend this product over the Premium HR strap for cost and durability.
customer_reviews.author: Gravel Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Zwift compatible way to keep tabs on your heart rate.
customer_reviews.text: ANT+ compatible and works out well. Sends data well to Zwift and shows up in Stava right on. I dont think this has ever dropped a sample. Its pretty standard fare for a heart rate strap. Plastic strip in the front that is soft enough and flexible enough that it doesn't chaff or scratch and an elastic strap that can be tightened to fit you.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Mercer

customer_reviews.title: But after a solid 10 minute warmup it usually kicks in good and will give me a good connection
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes takes a while to connect to my Concept2 PM5. But after a solid 10 minute warmup it usually kicks in good and will give me a good connection. I’m a 5’8 about 138 very athletic female, and this strap fits. It’s also pretty comfortable, I didn’t have any issues wearing it for long rows lasting over an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine

customer_reviews.title: Nonfunctional. A joke.
customer_reviews.text: Multiple strikes. Not compatible with Garmin app. Not even found in Garmin's own in-app search. So, downloaded both ANT+ and Strava app, and neither can find the device. Device has no sign whether on or off. So I opened it; battery seems loose. Pressed in to secure, popped up, pressed again to click. Still not visible to either app. On eighth try Strava found it and briefly displayed, but did not show a changing heart rate. Then it disappeared again, 6 inches from device. This device is a joke. And in order to return it has to be reboxed and driven across town? Amazing. Going in trash.
customer_reviews.author: G Bond

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable, great value
customer_reviews.text: Way better heart rate monitoring than my watches which just aren't very accurate compared to this! I have it directly connected to my phone using it's ANT+ antennae. I can use this and stream blue tooth from my phone at the same time. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: more accurate than wrist
customer_reviews.text: Slides around a bit more than the polar strap I used for years but seems to keep the beat. I use it during XC skate skiing, running and cycling; takes a bit to get used to the feel but chest straps are the most accurate way to get your heart rate especially if you are doing interval training.
customer_reviews.author: C. M.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as the heart rate monitor on my watch is inaccurate during intense workouts. This chest strap connects flawlessly to my Garmin Fenix 3HR. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Older version = better version
customer_reviews.text: So much more comfortable than the so called comfort strap/newer model. I wish I had tried this style years ago!! No rubs, easy to rinse off after use, and so far no issues. Can't comment on battery life as I've only been using it about a month.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Hinchliffe

customer_reviews.title: Garmin must be paying employees to give good ratings.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after only 8 months of light use (maybe 2 days a week, never in bad weather, was never dropped, etc..). Called Garmin and tried everything they suggested, they don't make returns easy so I decided it made more sense to buy different brand. Found out from other friends that they had same issue, so again, not sure where all these great reviews come from. It's cheap which is good, but it's cheap so if you want to buy a new one every year, buy it.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 9 months
customer_reviews.text: Used to work great until it didn't. No matter how many times I've tried new batteries or connection options with my Garmin Vivoactive it keeps stating "No sensors found" and yes, I'm wearing the HRM while trying to connect, and yes, applied water to the electrodes every single time that I've been trying to connect.
customer_reviews.author: Xcel64

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother if you're using it for spinning
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to use with our Peloton bike. Honestly, they're absolutely awful. They regularly lose signal or only register a static heart rate for the duration of your ride., so they are completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: M.S.

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my Vivofit
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my Vivofit, I just had to enable the heart HR screen in the Garmin app. What I find works best is if I put it on and then splash a little water on my skin where the sensors are located. It usually connects and updates right away if I do this. If I don't do this, it might take a minute or more to give me a reliable hr. Should have bought one long ago. It takes the guesswork out of exercising. Update, after exercise I take this in the shower with me and let it drip dry. If you don't do this, the cloth might start smelling from the sweat.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Reinholz

customer_reviews.title: Careful this requires a special system.
customer_reviews.text: Can’t use this. Apparently in the fine print somewhere you need a comparable system. I thought Bluetooth would be comparable, but was wrong. Completely worthless to me.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: wasted money for now till get ant reciever
customer_reviews.text: doesn't work w/samsung j7 phone, no app i found works on it. i need to buy ant+ reciever for it to even know if this strap even works. big hassel for me when i see this girl use it for her pc & worked, i tried with my pc & not compatable with bluetooth at all. so i don't even know if my hr monitor works now. it's useless right now. so now i need to waste more money on an ant+ reciever to connect it to my desktop if it'll even work. big disappointment on this strap.
customer_reviews.author: constina toro

customer_reviews.title: This little gadget is great so far
customer_reviews.text: This little gadget is great so far. Pairs to the watt bikes at my gym easily and syncs with garmin Vivoactive. Great addition as a workout Monitor, only issue is it doesn’t pair with Kaiser spin bikes but I’m told only Polar works with them, and as long as the hrm communicates with my watch it’s accurate enough for me! Great steal for useful workout Information
customer_reviews.author: Mandy P

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my Garmin watch. Pairs up fast, real time reading for you heart rate. More accurate than wrist sensors. Almost a year usage and haven't had to change the battery yet. Make sure to wash these after each use to avoid bacteria build up in the cloth strap. Affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: No real complaints
customer_reviews.text: Im not 100% convinced it is accurately tracking calories burned. Although I may only FEEL like Im working harder. It seems a little low compared to the Polar tracker results.
customer_reviews.author: Myra L Johnson

customer_reviews.title: My 2nd One
customer_reviews.text: I love my Garmin GPS watch and if I didn't have the heart rate monitor strap then I wouldn't be utilizing my watch to it's full potential. Sadly this is my second one simply because I washed my original one (like a fool). Don't let the confusion between the hard and soft strap difference trip you up. The hard strap is 75% soft and the actual heart monitor is the only hard part of the strap, while the soft strap is 100% soft (with the exception of the actual monitor). Either way you can't go wrong because I noticed no notable difference between the two straps except for the couple bucks you save going from soft to hard.
customer_reviews.author: D.K.

customer_reviews.title: Never reliable and now stopped working completely
customer_reviews.text: From the very beginning, it would only pick up HR once in the 100s. It started getting worse with time and now after 4 months, it has stopped working. I have replaced the battery, cleaned per instructions without any improvement. Using it on a Peloton Bike through ANT+ connection. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: 1+ year of use and still going.
customer_reviews.text: After a year of solid use I definitely recommend this. Running, biking, weightlifting, backpacking. This cheap little heart rate monitor has been through tons and still works and feels good.
customer_reviews.author: yepo

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I pair this with a Garmin Fenix3 HR and it works great. It is more accurate than the watch alone especially when lifting weights or doing anything that puts pressure on my wrist
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seemed to Work Just Fine.
customer_reviews.text: The chest strap monitor seemed to work fine. But the Forerunner 235 watch that I bought with it was no good, not good at all. Way too many hours of failed effort with tech support to try and get it to work. The monitor strap was returned with the watch. No problems with this item.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jimerson

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: This products works with the Garmin. But it's a pain to have to gel the leads every time, and it's a pain to put on. Once on, you have cold plastic against your skin. Despite tightening it as much as possible while still being able to breathe, it eventually slides down. But it does work. And it's a very inexpensive way go get your heart rate if your Garmin doesn't give it to you,
customer_reviews.author: Surface Pro 3 User

customer_reviews.title: Garmin Heart-Rate Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. I did not realize that it required ANT+ adapter but it was only for a iphone4, not iphone 5 PLUS it was for use on exercise equipment in a gym. I can't use it, but I had thrown away my ordering information so I'm stuck with it and I can't use it. All it said in the description was the following: Compatible With The Edge 305Hr And The Edgecad •Heart Beats Per Minute Wirelessly Transmitted to the Forerunner 50 •Effectively Tracks and Records your Heart Rate While you Workout •Provides Instant Feedback about How Hard your Heart is Working •0.35 Lbs (WxLxH) 2.5" x 3.0" x 2.74"
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn B. Stakelin

customer_reviews.title: Wahoo gives me the best info for spinning and connects to the Garmin fine
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Android Galaxy S5 receives signal at more than arms length (reason I purchased). Polar chest band kept dropping signal when watch was mounted on bars (a little farther than arms length). Apps tried with this were the Samsung S Health, Map my ride, and Wahoo. Wahoo gives me the best info for spinning and connects to the Garmin fine.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne F.

customer_reviews.title: accurate and long battery life
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a replacement - previous strap lasted 2.5 years. Very pleased with the tracker and HRM, which is very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: CaryNC-AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite Heart Rate Monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite Heart Rate Monitor. This is my second one in 8 years. I have tried the newer one and while it is a tad more comfortable than this one, it is more finicky. I have owned 4 different watches iver the years and it always has a solid connection.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan W

customer_reviews.title: Not A great buy. Unable to read heart
customer_reviews.text: It's an Ant plus device I could never get it to sync at the gym. Maybe it was defective. I am getting the runaround I was told to contact Garmin, I did Garmin said there is nothing they can do Not happy about money wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Darcia Carter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: When I first tried this HR Strap, I couldn't get it to pair, but with a new battery, it works great with my Garmin Edge 130. Luv it!
customer_reviews.author: G. Keppel

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and effective
customer_reviews.text: Greatly complements my Garmin Vivo3, for HIIT it really makes a difference in the heat rate measurements. Also the battery lasts for ever, I clarify this because is not rechargeable.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Luis Parcerisa

customer_reviews.title: Unusable on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Battery was completely dead on arrival. I'll update my review after I get a replacement battery, which I shouldn't really have to do with a brand new product. I can guarantee the rating isn't going over 3 because of this.
customer_reviews.author: 🤓

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, for good price.
customer_reviews.text: It works as good as the fabric one. But it doesn't get any smell and its easier to clean (is just plastic mostly). I bought this one because the other one after some use and washing, the sensors stated to come off. Recomended a 100%. I road a review that after a while it stars hurting your skin. But i have wore it for hours with no problem, directly into my skin. No need to be too tight to work.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Vega

customer_reviews.title: Works Great.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this monitor to use while working out on peloton. It works great. Had to look up directions on how to work it onYouTube.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superior to fenix alone for heart rate monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Low price but reliable w good fit for use w Fenix 5 watch. Much more accurate than the watch’s heart rate monitor for jogging, cycling and gym.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Better than soft strap for some people
customer_reviews.text: So in reading the reviews of some people about the Garmin Soft Strap heart rate monitor, some mentioned that they were getting little burn marks on their chest where the device sat. It happened to my wife too, but not with me. So we got this standard "hard" strap, and no burn marks. That being said, this strap is still very comfortable. Our old hear rate monitor by Polar, was extremely uncomfortable but we dealt with it for 5 years. This "hard" strap is still flexible, and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: FreeRadical

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for a few months and then died. I replaced battery and it still didn’t work. Emailed Garmin and nothing
customer_reviews.author: B. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Typical Garmin performance.  No complaints.
customer_reviews.text: Links up with my Garmin watch very well. I use one that has a wrist heart rate tracker on it, but use this strap when riding so I can strap the watch to my handle bar for monitoring my speed and heart rate at a glance without having to remove my hand from my handle bars. Works well. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Mulder Scully Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Works on app not on older treadmill
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an older one. Doesn't connect to my treadmill as it was bluetooth so using an app on my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Don H

customer_reviews.title: worked fine for about 1 year, then failed
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to work fine, then for no apparent reason, it would get a heart rate reading over 200 (actual around 120), and stay there despite repeated attempts to reset, clean, replace batteries, etc. It got so bad, that I would stop mid run to remove it, and use my Garmin's 235 optical HR, which would register at the more correct level.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Buckeye

customer_reviews.title: Working now, but showed up with dead battery
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure Garmin is making these anymore. They've replaced them with a much more expensive unit. I found this on Amazon and bought it. The unit was not working. I changed the battery and now it's working properly.
customer_reviews.author: Feedback2019

customer_reviews.title: Garmin vivo fit Best Yet
customer_reviews.text: The Vivo fit Garmin is the best overall health monitor I have used. Its tracking ability and the ability to view and print many reports such as heart rate, steps, sleep and almost any other activity you would like to monitor. To me the best feature is the fact that you do not, repeat not, have to charge it very often. My best yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jarhead

customer_reviews.title: need a garmin watch to use with it to monitor
customer_reviews.text: My son wanted this monitor but until recently has not done extensive running where he needs to monitor his heart. He says he needs a special watch, etc like a Garmin to be able to use it and monitor his heart. It is new and I wouold like to return it, even though it was purchased in December 2017.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Ledbetter

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: YOU HAVE TO PUT ON THE STRAP IN ORDER TO CONNECT/PAIR IT!!! Does the job. Sometimes read inaccurately, jumping heart rate to 200+ beats per minute. Securely fastened but will slowly inch downward. Good overall.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Xiong

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and seems more durable than the soft strap on ...
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and seems more durable than the soft strap on my polar monitor. Gave identical readings compared to the Polar monitor when paired with my Fenix 2, so at least as accurate. This is an excellent choice if you need an ANT+ sensor to work with a Garmin device.
customer_reviews.author: zombiesloth79

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!  Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This works as advertised. And I use a (ahem) non-Garmin app on my Android phone and can get great results downloaded.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great and exactly as intended. Don't really need to even wet the sensors if you sweat fairly quickly and I was able to connect it within minutes (and didn't even need to look up how to do so or anything). It's adjustable and comes ready to use
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: HR for the Edge 500
customer_reviews.text: Another great Garmin product. I've had my Garmin Edge 500 for 7 years and use it at least 400 time each year. While the computer has had no problems the HR monitor does wear out with use. I was happy to get the same monitor as I had originally. It works flawlessly!
customer_reviews.author: jmckeev

customer_reviews.title: This works great.  Very reliable and more comfortable than Garmin's "Deluxe" version
customer_reviews.text: This works fantastically. Always makes good contact with my skin and is comfortable. Pairs well and always makes good communication with my Garmin Edge 500, 510 and my old Wahoo iPhone plug in ANT+ dongle. Much more comfortable than my Garmin "Deluxe" HRM strap that came bundled with my Edge 510. This has lasted several years, and never even a battery change.
customer_reviews.author: RandyCPU

customer_reviews.title: Start monitor H-beat without wondering Edge 305.
customer_reviews.text: Buy upper model. This one is twitchy. Difficult to pair due to: Either poor instruction or band itself. Even after they are paired, GPS does not monitor my HR. I bought next expensive sensor and it is working. My GPS is Edge 305.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I got this for cheap (like $25l) Works great with my farm in watch.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Excellent HR monitor
customer_reviews.text: Misplaced my other HR monitor. It cost more than this one. I thought this one wouldn't work. It is perfect and it is more comfortable than the one I lost. So a win
customer_reviews.author: TanyaTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Garmin Got me AGAIN
customer_reviews.text: I find Garmin notorious for making expensive products, discontinuing the product, and then stop supporting the product. I cannot seem to pair this with my Galaxy S7 edge and all the ads say it can be done. Total FAIL.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: great band
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what I thought it would do. It doesn't slip and it gives a great reading
customer_reviews.author: Jon K.

customer_reviews.title: Garmin Heart Rate Monitor ANT +
customer_reviews.text: I needed an HRM that was ANT + capable and was not too expensive. Garmin HRM with ANT + turned out to be the answer to my quest. This HRM was quickly recognised by Wahoo Fitness iPhone App on my iPhone 4. I am using Wahoo Fisica attachment for iPhone. I compared my daily workouts with the Timex T5G981 HRM watch and was happy that the calories expended during my workouts were similar. I very satisfied with and highly recommend this HRM with the Wahoo Fitness app and Fisica attachment for iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Mortal Kombat

customer_reviews.title: Works Well with Forerunner 35
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with my new Garmin Forerunner 35. Follow the synch instructions in manual and it will synch automatically after that each time you select an "Activity" to track on the Forerunner (automatically overrides the wrist-based HR sensor.)
customer_reviews.author: NordicSkier

customer_reviews.title: Great strap
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a spin class and a fight camp and it worked perfectly. Never had any issues! Really great price.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton S.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done and pairs well with my Peloton bike.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Ant connection not bluetooth. I love this product. I am a runner and use it to track my progress. I use it with the Samsung health App, It doesn't "miss a beat" lol, lame. I do love it. Great price, accuracy and reliability.
customer_reviews.author: trin

customer_reviews.title: Never synced up or worked
customer_reviews.text: Big disappointment. Never sync with app no matter how many new updates I made. Waste of $$
customer_reviews.author: Nick Conte

customer_reviews.title: it worked fine when it was consistent
customer_reviews.text: After a few weeks, It works when it wants to. Uncomfortable and no real way to clean it properly. Being said, it worked fine when it was consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Seth R. Ayers

customer_reviews.title: Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't connect to any app. Tried everything, including new batteries. Never worked.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Paired Easily, Fits Nicely
customer_reviews.text: This product works exactly as expected. It paired easily with my, no problems whatsoever. I was worried about the hard plastic straps, but I find that they are very comfortable, and I am happy I chose this one over the more expensive model. I have rode about 60 miles with this on now since my purchase, and I have not once noticed I was wearing it while riding. I have always maintained connection with the computer. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan A. White

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product... Not a great product. Very comfortable. Pairs well with Endomondo and S-Health. No need for adapters when using Android phones. The only drawback is that the battery doesn't last 3 years (more like a year) and the cap to the battery chamber breaks after a year or so. ANT+ is so much better than blue tooth.
customer_reviews.author: Amy K Bridgeman

customer_reviews.title: Second Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I had my first heart rate monitor for about two years. This is my second one of this kind. I love that I can easily wash the strap and adjust it as needed. The battery died in my old one, and when I replaced it, I did not lock the back well... It started to rust, so I had to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Buy it. See your heart explode.
customer_reviews.text: Instantly connects to Garmin GPS’s. Does not even show on Apple Watch or iPhone X. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Wood

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I am a total newbie when it comes to heart rate monitors and all of the gadgets but this has been incredibly easy to use. No issues so far. I was worried about the reviews talking about the discomfort of the hard plastic band but I hardly notice it. Also the price is AMAZING compared to some of the others.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Verdin

customer_reviews.title: Better than the "premium" strap.
customer_reviews.text: Half the price of the "premium" HRM strap and just as comfortable. BUT better in my opinion. Over time the sensor snaps on the premium strap corrode from sweat and its no longer accurate. It will say something like 98bpm while climbing a 20% grade hill on the MTB. After switching to this strap I've had zero issues.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great value.  Basic necessity for excercise
customer_reviews.text: This is great for the price. I really thought I would be uncomfortable wearing it, but it is completely unnoticeable while I run. I realize there is a 'soft strap' version of this, but I don't see any reason for it. This is totally acceptable for comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 8 months
customer_reviews.text: Mine worked for 8 months then quit. I changed the battery, then bought another battery just to be sure. Still dead. I use it for cycling, never in wet conditions. The original HRM strap that came with the Garmin unit lasted for six years. Are these genuine Garmin HRMs? I gave it two stars instead of one because of the very low price.
customer_reviews.author: clarkras

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Really nothing more to say, except Amazon wants me to type more.
customer_reviews.author: Tad

customer_reviews.title: I find this strap to be more comfortable than my previous Polar straps
customer_reviews.text: I find this strap to be more comfortable than my previous Polar straps. However, it seems to stretch out more easily, and moves around a lot. I lost a lot of HR data on a run because it kept moving around and couldn't pick up my heart rate. If I don't tighten it before each workout, the data is all over the place. I've used it for both outdoor runs and my indoor barre classes, and it's been great otherwise. I use it with the Garmin ForeRunner 15.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Tucker

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have not had any issue with this Heart Rate Monitor! It connected to my VivoFit and my Garmin App with easy! I use it with every workout every time!
customer_reviews.author: Donald

product_meta.title: Garmin Heart Rate Monitor
product_meta.description:
Get a quality workout with our heart rate monitor. When worn around your chest during an activity, it wirelessly transmits your heart rate to your compatible device for instant feedback on how hard you’re working.

The front part of the strap contains the heart rate module and is made of flexible plastic. The part of the strap that goes around your back is made of a soft fabric and is adjustable to your size.

Use and care of the heart rate monitor is a snap. Once it's paired with your compatible device the first time, it will automatically recognize it each time. The fabric of the strap can be removed and hand-washed as often as needed. 


 * Water Resistance: 32.9 ft (10 m)*
 * Battery: User-replaceable size CR2032 (3 volts)
 * Battery Life: Approximately 3 years (based on average use of 1 hour per day)
 * Operating Temperature: 14°F–122°F (-10°C–50°C)**
 * Radio Frequency/Protocol: 2.4 GHz ANT wireless communications protocol
 * Range: 3 m

*Does not transmit heart rate data to your device while swimming.
**In cold conditions, wear warm clothing to keep the heart rate monitor close to your body temperature.
feature_bullets: Compatible With The Edge 305Hr And The Edgecad
Heart Beats Per Minute Wirelessly Transmitted to the Forerunner 50
Effectively Tracks and Records your Heart Rate While you Workout
Provides Instant Feedback about How Hard your Heart is Working
